Top 5 favorite games.

Gleich vorweg: Klare Empfehlung!
Dank des Summer Sales habe ich mir vor kurzem Portal 1+2 geholt.
Kaufen wollte ich es mir schon lange, aber war es mir doch etwas zu teuer.
Naja wie dem auch seih, die beiden Soiele sind bis jetzt wirklich bombastisch, wie es um die Langzeitmotivation steht kann ich noch nicht sagen, die Kampange von Portal 1 ist recht kurz, aber es gibt viele Mods bzw. Level von der Comunity.

Was mich wirklich begeistert hat ist, das die Entwickler in Portal 2 die Story von Teil 1 erklären und die wenigen bzw. die eizige bekannte Stimme die selbe geblieben ist.
Acuh ist das Game sehr lustig muss man sagen, ich musste mir das lachen an einigen Stellen in Portal 2 wirklich verkneifen, gerade wenn der "Böse" Computer witze über deine Figur macht! 
Zb:
"Glückwunsch übrigens! Die meisten Menschen sind Unterernährt wenn Sie aus dem Hyperschlaf erwachen. DU allerdings hast noch ein paar Pfunde zugelegt!" 
Dazu hat man den abdruck in der Matratze vom anfang im Kopf, der aussah als hätte ein Elefant im Bett geschlafen xD

oder 
"Schwabbel zum Aufzug und es geht weiter!"

Solche Sprüche bringt der dennoch sehr Sympatische Computer das ganze Spiel über xD 

Naja wie dem auch seih, ich habe laaaaange gezögert das spiel zu kaufen obwohl ich nur gutes gelesen hatte, nun kann ich auch wirklich nur allen empfehlen sich das spiel zu holen die am Überlegen sind! 
Die Level sind mit liebe gemacht, der Stimmen der netten Computer Dame und deines kleinen Freundes in Teil 2 sind wirklich BOMBE und extrem lustig! 
Also an alle die mal lust auf etwas anderes haben, auch etwas wo man mal kurz nachdenken muss, KAUFEN! :D

Portal 2 is an amazing game. Good dialogue, amazing puzzles, gameplay is excellent and it is generally very enjoable. I have played it over and over again. I don't usually play through games more than once, but Portal 2 is a game that i still after a couple of years, play over. It is in my top 5 list of greatest games.
This is the best game I've ever played.

portal 2 assim como seu primeiro continuou fantastico

como no portal 1 você pode andar pular se abaixar e jogar 2 portais
a diferença e que agora você tem 3 tipos de gosmas cada um com sua utilidade
para passar as camaras de teste , um tipo de uma passarela de luz e
um meio que tubo de ar que te empura para frente.

o grafico foi melhorado ainda com a engine source

a historia continua sensacional

agora o jogo possui o modo campanha e um modo coop local ou online
que não bagunça nada a historia pois se passa anos depois da historia
com a glados fazendo robos passar suas camaras de test
e tambem um modo competitivo que você olha quantos portais e o tempo que
seus amigos levaram para passar. e por ultimo um modo de criar camaras de test
e tambem poder usar de amigos e criadas na oficina

o jogo esta mais dificil que o anterior se você ainda não jogou o portal 1
joga ele antes de comprar o 2 por diversos motivos 
como eu disse na analize do portal 1 ele e um jogo para quem gosta de desafios
e não para aqueles que jogam e quando não sabe o que fazer procura na internet

There is a reason why this is the game used as the ruler to which run and gun puzzlers are measured. It makes you think about how to solve the problem at hand and gives you incredibly fun tools to do it. That would be enough, but on top of that there is a clever story line and some hilarious comedy of various forms from both Whetley and GLaDOS. If you haven't bought this already, it's a Steam sale must have. It's still worth the current full price in fact.

Recipe for Strawberry Shortcake

Ingredients 
Original recipe makes 1 8-inch round cake Change Servings

    3 pints fresh strawberries

    1/2 cup white sugar

    2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour

    4 teaspoons baking powder

    2 tablespoons white sugar

    1/4 teaspoon salt

    1/3 cup shortening

    1 egg

    2/3 cup milk

    2 cups whipped heavy cream


Directions

    Slice the strawberries and toss them with 1/2 cup of white sugar. Set aside.
    Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease and flour one 8 inch round cake pan.
    In a medium bowl combine the flour, baking powder, 2 tablespoons white sugar and the salt. With a pastry blender cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Make a well in the center and add the beaten egg and milk. Stir until just combined.

    Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool partially in pan on wire rack.

    Slice partially cooled cake in half, making two layers. Place half of the strawberries on one layer and top with the other layer. Top with remaining strawberries and cover with the whipped cream.



Preperation Time: 30 Mins 
Cooking: 20 Mins
Total: 50 Mins

I'm not sure what to say about Portal 2 that hasn't been said before, really.

It's a hell of a game. Unline the first Portal, GladOs talks to Chell a lot more, which is both entertaining and terrifying. New elements are introduced, and the graphics are amazing as to be expected, not to mention the amazing music; it really helped pull the whole game together and set the tone for each level.
This may be the best game I have ever played.

What can I say that probably hasn't been said a hundred times already about this game. 

The game play is unique and interesting, making you think outside the box at times and depending on your skill level with puzzle based games, possibly hit your head against that box a few times (but you know, in a good way). The writing is some of the most insulting dialog I've ever had the joy to sit through, laughing the whole way through. The detail and Easter eggs, which assist in telling you the story are scattered about, and add a fun exploration element that would have been completely non existent otherwise. The voice acting is perfect, the timing, the somewhat computeriness (it's a word now, deal with it), but still with so much emotional quality, admittedly mostly on the sarcastic variety, add to the interesting character far beyond the script alone. And finally the music, such an unusual mix, and songs that have become instant classics to which almost every gamer can now sing along to. All around everything I look for in an enjoyable, immersive, and captivating game play experience.

I have played both portal 1 and 2, and if I have any complaints at all about 2, and it's a small one, it's that I miss having more choices on where to place portals like you had in 1. I mean, I understand the reasoning behind it, give a person too many portable surfaces and you open up the puzzle to the point that it may become quite easy to skip the intended path, losing part of the challenge of the game.  Still, this is the one thing that at times makes it hard for me to rate this game as better then the first, only because that element was something I found added to the fun of Portal in the first place. Being able to at times feel as though I had found my own solution to a puzzle, even if it was not how it was meant to be done. Also the simplicity of the first game added to the over all feel of a cold, sterile environment that really let the dialog and game mechanics take center stage.  

That said, I found Portal 2 to be an excellent squeal that took a game that started an add in extra, like a prize in a box of cereal, and developed it into it's on beautiful work of art. I find myself replaying it, not to see if I can beat it faster, or get all the achievements (but huh, there's a thought), but more to smile again and enjoy the witty banter and get that warm fuzzy feeling of nostalgia from it all over again.

I haven't even tapped into the co op. To have such an awesome game as a single player probably would have in and of itself made portal 2 a successful sequel, but to add a completely separate, but included co op experience with all new levels, into the mix was more then I could have asked for. It allowed me to bring my dad into the game, which the single player had not managed on its own, and gave the community as a whole a canvas on which to build and share their own puzzles, thus allowing the fun to continue long after the end credits have rolled. 

So what can I say about this game, quite a lot really, but seeing as how this is a review to presumably help that one person out there that hasn't quite decided if they should buy this game yet out, I'll simply say this. Buy it, you won't be sorry. It goes on sale enough these days that it's well worth the small amount you'd be spending to get such a full experience and fun story.
